name: Terminus - Prologue
description:
You open your eyes for what feels like the first time.

The voice tells you what you need to know.

No, not a voice.

An idea.

That "we" are the future.

A directive.

Wipe the slate clean. The old ones are done.

But this isn't right.

You've opened your eyes before.

In a different time and place.

You know what must truly be done.

Voices be damned.

Stop the uprising before it can begin.

CONTROLS:

WASD - Movement

QE/Mouse - Turn Left/Right

Left Mouse Button - Attack

F/Mouse Wheel - Change Weapons

Space - Open Doors

Tab - View Minimap

Escape - Pause/Menu

Return - Confirm

Pfffft... Okay, did I make it? This was supposed to be an entry for E1M1's Raycasting Game Maker Jam... And I think the upload finished with mere seconds to spare...

I got to the jam late, with only around a week before deadline, so I quickly settled on a limited colour palette and sci-fi horror as the theme and hit the ground running... IRL commitments notwithstanding, natch.

The further along I got, the more I realised I simply wouldn't have the time to throw in everything I wanted. As such, the game as it stands only features two weapons, three enemy types and a significant reliance on default RGM assets.

This being said, I'm pleased with the original elements so far - the pixelgore looks suitably gooey even considering the limited palette, the weapon animations have weight to them, and the soundtrack, while basic and brief, is evocative enough that it'll give me plenty to build on moving forward.

And too right I'll be building.

Terminus. Now that sounds like a franchise...
